verbose_text: In Cox proportional hazards models adjusting for age, WBC, GGT, log (hsCRP), HOMA-IR, serum creatinine, TIBC, current smoking status, regular exercise, alcohol intake, hypertension, and diabetes (model 3), the adjusted HRs and 95% CI for MetS across baseline quintile groups of serum ferritin levels were 1.19 (0.98-1.45), 1.17 (0.96-1.43), 1.36 (1.12-1.65), and 1.66 (1.38-2.01), respectively (P for trend < 0.001).
